summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unspecified recipient to appear and produce specific financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein's account for the billing cycle ending May 2, 2004, as part of the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the matter for which the subpoena is issued.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands records for an account in his name (0043811863), specifically for the billing cycle ending May 2, 2004.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued and signed the subpoena in her capacity as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The subpoena is issued for the case against Maxwell, seeking records from an account in Epstein's name, indicating their legal and financial connection in the investigation.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the criminal case against Maxwell, as indicated by the subpoena she issued.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Records Production
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, to testify and produce specific financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein's account.

events.title: Billing Cycle End Date for Epstein Account
events.description: The subpoena specifically requests records for the account in Jeffrey Epstein's name for the billing cycle ending on or about this date.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
It demands production of all usage and the monthly invoice dated May 5, 2004, for account 0043811863 in the name of Jeffrey E Epstein.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on July 19, 2021, for an appearance scheduled for November 29, 2021.
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The specific financial records sought are from May 2004, indicating investigators are examining financial activity from that period.
